title: Space used for Swift doesn't check for usage in a _segments container

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

N/A

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

The amount of space used with `rclone mount` when Swift is used as a backend doesn't include the size of objects stored in a corresponding _segments container.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

1.71.1 using the amd64 .deb downloaded from this repo.

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Debian Trixie

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

OpenStack Swift

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone mount --debug-fuse -vv nxhome:nx-home /mnt --vfs-fast-fingerprint  --dump-bodies
df -h /mnt

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

The output of /mnt is (I'm experimenting with quotes, has 96M available):

```
root@nvr3:/# df -h /mnt
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
nxhome:nx-home   96M     0   96M   0% /mnt
root@nvr3:/# 
```

But the amount of space actually used is:

```
root@nvr3:/# du -sh /mnt
55M	/mnt
root@nvr3:/# 
```

I have --dump-bodies running and this is the only call that fetches used space:
